examples: The singer has issued a sweeping denial of all the rumors.
The denial of "There might be X" is the null, "False, there is no X."

entries.meaning: A refusal or failure to provide or grant something that is requested or desired.
examples: The denial of medical treatment to those who cannot afford to pay is scandalous.
I cannot understand the bank's denial of my loan application.
Every time we asked for an interview we got a denial.

entries.meaning: Refusal to believe that a problem exists.
examples: We couldn't break through his denial about being alcoholic.

entries.meaning: Refusal to admit responsibility for wrongdoing.
Negationism, denialism of historical facts or accepted interpretation.
(psychology) A defense mechanism involving a refusal to accept the truth of a phenomenon or prospect.
examples: "Denial" came out of the therapyspeak prevalent in the middle of the 20th century, especially as it was applied to confronting the reality of mortality. It was popularized as the first stage of grief, and quickly expanded to include refusal to confront any bad news or disturbing ideas.
The denial of Jesus by Peter.
